{{cpp/title|copysign|copysignf|copysignl}}
{{cpp/numeric/math/navbar}}
{{cpp/numeric/math/declarations
|family=copysign
|param1=mag
|param2=sgn
|constexpr_since=23
|desc=Composes a floating point value with the magnitude of {{c|mag}} and the sign of {{c|sgn}}.
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|mag, sgn|floating-point or integer values}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
If no errors occur, the floating point value with the magnitude of {{c|mag}} and the sign of {{c|sgn}} is returned.

If {{c|mag}} is NaN, then NaN with the sign of {{c|sgn}} is returned.

If {{c|sgn}} is -0, the result is only negative if the implementation supports the signed zero consistently in arithmetic operations.

===Error handling===
This function is not subject to any errors specified in {{lc|math_errhandling}}.

If the implementation supports IEEE floating-point arithmetic (IEC 60559),
* The returned value is exact ({{lc|FE_INEXACT}} is never raised) and independent of the current [[cpp/numeric/fenv/FE_round|rounding mode]].

===Notes===
{{tt|std::copysign}} is the only portable way to manipulate the sign of a NaN value (to examine the sign of a NaN, {{lc|std::signbit}} may also be used).

{{cpp/numeric/math/additional overload note|copysign}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cmath&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::showpos
              &lt;&lt; "copysign(1.0,+2.0) = " &lt;&lt; std::copysign(1.0, +2.0) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "copysign(1.0,-2.0) = " &lt;&lt; std::copysign(1.0, -2.0) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "copysign(inf,-2.0) = " &lt;&lt; std::copysign(INFINITY, -2.0) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "copysign(NaN,-2.0) = " &lt;&lt; std::copysign(NAN, -2.0) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
copysign(1.0,+2.0) = +1
copysign(1.0,-2.0) = -1
copysign(inf,-2.0) = -inf
copysign(NaN,-2.0) = -nan
}}
